magpie.models.regression

Interface AbstractRegressionModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNonlinearRegression, AbstractParsedNonlinearRegression, BaseRegression, ClassificationRegression, CompositeRegression, GuessMeanRegression, LASSORegression, LinearCorrectedRegression, MetallurgicalHeuristicRegression, MixingRuleRegression, MultiObjectiveRegression, MultiPropertyRegression, NonlinearRegressionExpr, PolynomialRegression, RandomGuessRegression, ScikitLearnRegression, SimpleLinearModelExample, SingleGuessRegression, SplitRegression, StagedRegression, WekaRegression

    public interface AbstractRegressionModel
    Interface for all regression models.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean doRobustRegression()
      Whether robust regression is desired.

      Number of fitting parameters in a model.

    • Method Detail

      • robustTraining

        void robustTraining(Dataset TrainData)
        Robustly train a model. Is called from BaseModel.train(magpie.data.Dataset).

        I recommend that you use methods outlined in a paper by Motulsky and Brown.

        .
        Parameters:
        TrainData - Training data

      • setRobustRegressionQ

        void setRobustRegressionQ(double Q)
        Set the desired False Discovery Rate for outlier detection. A robust regression parameter of 0.01 is recommended. Zero turns it off. Don't give it less than zero.

        See paper by Benjamini and Hochberg

        Parameters:
        Q - Desired FDR

      • getRobustRegressionQ

        double getRobustRegressionQ()
        Get desired False Discovery Rate
        Returns:
        Target FDR

      • doRobustRegression

        boolean doRobustRegression()
        Whether robust regression is desired. For now, this should be:
        getRobustRegressionQ > 0

      • getNFittingParameters

        int getNFittingParameters()
        Number of fitting parameters in a model. Only pertinent to nonlinear regression. Otherwise, this should just return 0.
        Returns:
        Number of fitting parameters
